title: The Bauxite and Alumina Industries (Encouragement) Act
title_en: The Bauxite and Alumina Industries (Encouragement) Act

provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Bauxite and Alumina
Industries (Encouragement) Regulations, 1953.
   1 ~In. these Regulations, “Commissioner” means the Commissioner
of Customs and Excise.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In these Regulations, unless the context otherwise requires-     .
    “contractor” means the holder of a contract with a producer to
        perform construction work under the Act;
    “duty” includes customs duty, tonnage tax or other similar impost;
    “producer” means any person declared under the Act to be a
        recognized bauxite prcducer or a recognized alumina producer
        or both.

provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3. Every producer or contractor who imports any article free of
duty under the provisions of the Act, shall if so directed by the
Commissioner cause a distinctive mark prescribed by the Commissioner
to be placed upon such article.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4 . 4 1 ) Every producer or contractor shall keep a stock book in
respect of articles imported free of duty.
      (2) The following provisions shall have effect in respect of the
stock book specified in paragraph (1)-
    (a) the stock book shall be in such form as may be prescribed
         or may ibe approved by the Commissioner;
    (b) there shall be entered in the stock book such particulars as may
         be prescribed by the Commissioner, and the book shall be
         kept in such manner as may be required by him;
4     THE BAUXITE A N D ALUMINA INDUSTRIES (ENCOURAGEMENT)
                         REGULATIONS. 1953
        (c) any person or persons authorized in writing by the Commis-
            sioner shall be entitled at all reasonable tima to enter upon
            the premises occupied by or under the control of a producer
            or contractor for the purpose of inspecting the stock book
            or any article imported free of duty;
        (d) the stock book shall be preserved for six years after the date
             of the last entry therein.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5. Every producer or contractor shall furnish to the Commissioner
    at such times as the Commissioner may appoint a return of articles
    imported free of duty, which have been transferred to other persons
    entitled to import such articles free of duty. Every such person shall
    also make a return of the articles received:
       Provided that it shall not be necessary to include in such return any
    article transferred more than five years next after the date of its importa-
    tion into Jamaica.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6. Any person who contravenes any of these Regulations shall be
    guilty of an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction before
    a Resident Magistrate,to a fine not exceeding one thousand dollars or
    to a term of imprisonment with hard labour not exceeding twelve
    months or to both such fine and imprisonment.
